III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section Intervention standards and prohibitions
Description (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 9/23/25, a youth was separated from other youth and taken
upstairs to shower. There was a crash and a piece of broken brick
found in the shower stall, but the youth was not injured. The youth
stepped out of the shower and locked themself in the office. The
door was taken of the hinges. The youth was by the furnace and a
staff member walked toward the youth and reached their hand out.
The youth reported that the staff member hit them. No injury was
observed.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
9/25/2025. Youth A reported she was taken to the administration
building to shower and while in the shower she fell and hit her
head. Youth A reported Nurse came in to assist her and
assessed her in the bathroom as Youth A reported she was
unable to get up after falling. Youth A reported she was advised
to take her shower and Youth A reported she did not want to.
Youth A reported she came out of the shower and ran into an
office room outside the bathroom and locked herself in the office.
Youth A reported Assistant Facility Administrator came in after
removing the door, grabbed her by the arm and punched her in
the right arm. Youth A reported the incident happened fast and
did not recall specifically how Assistant Facility Administrator hit
her. Youth A reported she fell to the ground and Assistant Facility
Administrator told her to get up. Youth A reported she walked out
of the office and Assistant Facility Administrator followed her.
Youth A reported Nurse, Staff 1, and Staff 2 were present and
witnessed the incident. Youth A reported she was assessed by
Nurse. Youth A reported her arm is bruised and hurts. Youth A’s
arm was viewed, and no bruise was observed.
Assistant Facility Administrator was interviewed face-to-face
at the facility on 9/25/2025. Assistant Facility Administrator
reported Youth A was taken to shower in the Administration
building by Staff 1 and Staff 2. Assistant Facility Administrator
reported he and Nurse were contacted to assist at the
administration building as Youth A reported she fell in the shower
2

and could not get up. Nurse assessed Youth A and no concerns
were noted. Youth A went back into shower, Assistant Facility
Administrator reported soon after Youth A turned off the shower
and came out of the bathroom stating she did not want to shower.
Assistant Facility Administrator reported Youth A wanted to head
back to the unit however due to concerns and incidents with other
youth, Youth A was informed she was unable to go back to the
unit and would remain in the administration building until Youth A
was ready to head back to the classroom area. Assistant Facility
Administrator reported Youth A ran into an office room and locked
herself in the office. Assistant Facility Administrator reported
Nurse took the pins out of the door and removed the office door to
get into the office. Assistant Facility Administrator reported Youth
A had gone into the furnace room area and he reached his hand
toward Youth A to guide Youth A out of the area and Youth A
stated he hit her. Assistant Facility Administrator reported Youth A
demanded to see Nurse who was present and assessed Youth A.
Assistant Facility Administrator reported he never hit Youth A nor
did any other staff. Assistant Facility Administrator reported he
reached his arm out and never made physical contact with Youth
A. Assistant Facility Administrator reported Youth A had no
injuries.
Nurse was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
9/25/2025. Nurse reported she was called due to Youth A falling
while in the bathroom. Nurse and Assistant Facility Administrator
went to assist Youth A, Staff 1, and Staff 2 in the administration
building. Nurse reported she and Staff 1 went into the bathroom
to assist Youth A who reported she fell and hit her head on a
piece of cement. Nurse reported Youth A was fully dressed and
had not yet gotten in the shower and the floor was dry. Nurse
reported she assessed Youth A’s head and there was a small red
dot on Youth A’s head. Nurse reported Youth A stated she was ok
and was going to continue with her shower so she and Staff 1
exited the bathroom. Nurse reported she was outside the
bathroom with Assistant Facility Administrator, Staff 1, and Staff 2.
Nurse reported Youth A opened the bathroom door and ran out
and into a former office and locked herself inside. Nurse reported
she popped the pins on the door to remove the door. Nurse
reported Assistant Facility Administrator stepped in and reached
his arm out to Youth A and Youth A dropped to the ground and
began stating Assistant Facility Administrator punched her. Nurse
reported she witnessed the whole incident and Assistant Facility
Administrator never punched Youth A nor did he touch her in any
way. Nurse reported she assessed Youth A’s right arm where
Youth A reported Assistant Facility Administrator punched her.
3

Nurse reported Youth A was rubbing her arm which caused her
arm to slightly turn red however there was no marks or any
indication she had been punched.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
9/25/2025. Staff 1 reported she and Staff 2 took Youth A to the
administration building to shower. While Youth A was getting
ready to shower, Youth A stated she slipped in the toilet area of
the bathroom and couldn’t get up. Staff 1 reported Assistant
Facility Administrator and Nurse were contacted to come assist.
Staff 1 reported Youth A was assessed and appeared to be ok
and was advised to go forward with her shower. Staff 1 reported
Youth A was back in the bathroom to shower and a few minutes
later opened the bathroom door and ran out of the bathroom into
an office nearby and locked herself in the office. Youth A refused
to unlock the door at which time the door was taken off the hinges
by Nurse and Assistant Facility Administrator. Youth A had
barricaded herself near the furnace in the office trying to hide.
Staff 1 reported Assistant Facility Administrator told Youth A to get
up as Youth A was squatted down by the furnace, Youth A stood
up and Assistant Facility Administrator put his arm out toward
Youth A. Staff 1 reported Youth A fell to the ground “in a very
dramatic way” and stated Assistant Facility Administrator punched
her. Staff 1 reported she saw the whole incident and Assistant
Facility Administrator never punched Youth A. Staff 1 reported
Nurse assessed Youth A and there was no injury. Staff 1 reported
Youth A was stating there was a red mark on her right shoulder
however she did not see any injury.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
10/8/2025. Staff 2 reported he and Staff 1 took Youth A to the
administration building to shower. Staff 2 reported Youth A made
noises while in the bathroom and claimed she had fallen. Staff 2
reported Assistant Facility Administrator and Nurse were
contacted to come assess Youth A as she alleged she fell while
getting ready to shower. Youth A went back in to shower and
opened the door, ran out of the shower, ran into a nearby office,
and locked herself in the office. Staff 2 reported the door was
removed then he and Assistant Facility Administrator went into the
office and approached Youth A to escort Youth A out of the office.
Staff 2 reported Youth A dropped to the ground and stated “you
trying to punch me” to Assistant Facility Administrator. Staff 2
reported Assistant Facility Administrator did not even touch Youth
A and never punched and/or hit Youth A. Staff 2 reported Staff 1
and Nurse were both present.
4

Video Reviewed:
There was no video footage to review as there were no cameras
in the area the alleged incident occurred.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth Opportunity Osceola Youth Center Safe Crisis
Management and Physical Intervention: Prohibited
practices include hitting or striking, throwing, kicking,
pulling, or pushing a youth on any part of their body.
• Youth Opportunity Investments Incident Report dated
9/23/2025 for Youth A was consistent with Assistant Facility
Administrator, Nurse, Staff 1, and Staff 2’s interviews.
• Youth Opportunity Nurse Note dated 9/23/2025: Youth A
had fallen in the bathroom. Youth A reported she fell and
hit her head on a piece of brick. Youth A was examined
and had a small red bump but no bleeding or no scratches.
Youth A’s eyes dilated normally and she experienced no
confusion or zoning out. Youth A’s arm was examined
where she stated Assistant Facility Administrator punched
her and there were no marks, bruising, or swelling.
• Assistant Facility Administrator’s personnel file: Assistant
Facility Administrator has no discipline in his personnel file
and received Safe Crisis Management recertification
training on 3/19/2025 and 3/20/2025.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per interviews Youth A was
never hit/punched by Assistant Facility Administrator as Nurse,
Staff 1, and Staff 2 were present and witnessed the incident and
reported Assistant Facility Administrator never even touched
Youth A during the incident.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
